job_title: Writing Consultant in Rocky Mount, NC
pros: Working at NCWC has been amazing. Since it is a really small college, it is easy to feel as if you are part of a big, happy family. People are always friendly and welcoming.
cons: Being a small college, NCWC also has disadvantages due to its size. For instance, there are not many jobs available. And sometimes the pay can be quite low.

pros: Flexible work environment, in certain departments.
cons: Awful salaries and belief that employees need to take on more when budget calls for it.

job_title: Financial Aid Advisor & Student Employment Coordinator in Whitakers, NC
pros: The best part about working at North Carolina Wesleyan College was being able to help assist and facilitate the needs of the students. The overall comraderie of the staff was an added asset.
cons: The cons of working at North Carolina Wesleyan College in the financial aid office was having to consistently work overtime due to being understaffed.

review_title: Good Opportunity for Small Town Job
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Rocky Mount, NC
pros: Most of the people are friendly and genuinely want to see you succeed in your work. The campus is small but pretty, and the President is an alum of the school.
cons: Campus affairs can become very political. If you do not have a religious background, you may not agree with everything the current administration is pushing. Facilities are older.
None-work is a great thing to do.
